revised_title: Molecular Chaperones and Their Role in Antigen Processing and Immune Response
tldr: This article discusses the role of molecular chaperones, specifically heat shock proteins, in the immune response to various infections. It highlights how molecular chaperones are prominent antigens and how they may contribute to protective immunity or have pathological autoimmune consequences. The article also explores the possibility of molecular chaperones playing a functional role in antigen processing and presentation during class II-restricted T lymphocyte responses.
